Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2015 03:23PM AnnieIam wrote: oh how my heart breaks for you. I'm so incredibly sad. I too have a 12 year old and know your heart's desire. I will be praying for you. May you be blessed with more time and pain free moments with which to make loads of memories Annie
Posts.Title: Hospice for me Annie62 RonnieKay

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2015 03:10PM AnnieIam wrote: afraid t's amazing how only once something happens to you or a very close loved one do you understand things better. I never thought for one moment I would ever find myself in this situation . I can almost understand when people make these dumb statements , I probably made them too. It's not that I didn't have sympathy for their situation , I simply didn't understand the difference between the different stages and what mets meant. Now I find myself having to explain to ppl that I've got terminal cancer . There is no cure. Only those who "get it" will regularly contact me to find out how I'm really doing, the rest have slowly started disappearing. I think they're more afraid than me.

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2015 01:35PM AnnieIam wrote: For better or worse, our families are along for the ride. They love you and if anyone had to ask whether you spoilt their holiday , I'd bet they'd all scream NO at the same time. I'm glad you're home and recovering Warm hugs
Posts.Title: Feeling robbed Fluffernutter pearlady

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2015 02:04PM AnnieIam wrote: leftfoot, I am so sorry that you and your family are having to go through this. There are times when all this cancer rubbish is so surreal . It's like this can't possibly be happening to me. Then I realise that it's happening to my loved ones too. It's happening to my 12 year old . In the beginning when I was just dx with Stage 4 , I thought of writing letters to my family, especially my son. Then I decided that I will not reach from beyond the grave and upset him every significant birthday or occasion (just my opinion) I will spend as much time and make as many wonderful memories as possible. Besides , for me it's kinda like giving up and that scares me. Hang in there and make sure you rest and get your strength back. I'll be thinking about you .

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2015 07:39PM AnnieIam wrote: It's amazing the things we go through to stay alive. What a day you had....phew! I'm so glad that everything is settled for now. Now you can concentrate on preparing for surgery and planning for recovery . Make sure you round up your support system so that they can make things a bit easier. In the meantime , I pray for every success Warm hugs Annie
